body: Writing out this code to do what it's supposed to do, *and* check the invariant would be annoying, because it would need a loop over uses. Since it's really an invariant, I don't think we need to assert it at every single step. It would be a loud failure if we were to violate it I guess.
body_html: Writing out this code to do what it's supposed to do, and check the invariant would be annoying, because it would need a loop over uses. Since it's really an invariant, I don't think we need to assert it at every single step. It would be a loud failure if we were to violate it I guess.
body_text: Writing out this code to do what it's supposed to do, and check the invariant would be annoying, because it would need a loop over uses. Since it's really an invariant, I don't think we need to assert it at every single step. It would be a loud failure if we were to violate it I guess.
